gurmukhi: posq BwNg APIm Gno md pIvn ky iqn kwj mMgwXo ] mMgn logn bol pTXo bhu Awvq By jin pwr n pwXo ]2112]
transliteration: Post Bhaan Afim Ghano Mad Peevan Ke Tin Kaaj Manadyo|| Manad Logad Bol Pathyo Bahu Aavat Bhe Jan(i) Paar Na Paayo||2112||
translation: There he caused to be brought Poppy plant, hemp, opium and various kinds of wines for drinking, there he also called many beggars and singers, who came in groups.2112.

gurmukhi: bhu rwmjnI qh nwcq hY iek JwJr bIn miRdMg bjwvY ] dY iek JUmk Awvq hY iek Bwmn dY hir JUmk jwvY ]
transliteration: Bahu Raamjaneeah Naachat Hai Ik Jhaajhar Been Mridan Bajaavai|| Dai Ik Jhoomak Aavat Hai Ik Bhaamannddai Har(i) Jhoomak Jaavai||
translation: Many concubines, playing their anklets, lyres and drums began to dance there; someone is dancing while revolving, and some woman is spinning on all the four sides of Krishna;

gurmukhi: kwnH ptMbr dyq iqnY mn lwl Gny icq ko ju irJwvY ] sXwm BnY bhu mol Kry surrwjih ko joaU hwQ n AwvY ]2113]
transliteration: Kaahn Patanbar Det Tinai Man Laal Ghane Chit Ko Ju Rijhaavai|| Syaam Bhanai Bahu Mol Kdare Sur-raajah(i) Ko Jooo Haath Na Aavai||2113||
translation: Krishna is giving them comfortable raiments, gems and jewels; he is giving such precious things to them, which even Indra cannot procure.2113.

gurmukhi: pwvq rwmjnI nc kY Dn pwvq hY bhu dwn gv`Xw ] eyk irJwvq hY hir ko kib sXwm BnY pV CMq sv`Xw ]
transliteration: Paavat Raamjaninach Kai Dhan Paavat Hai Bahu Daan Gadayyaa|| Ek Rijhaavat Hai Har(i) Ko Kabi Syaam Bhanai Pad Chhant Sawayyaa||
translation: The concubines after dancing and the singers after singing are receiving great gifts; someone is pleasing Krishna by reciting poetry and someone is pleasing him by reciting various stanzas;

gurmukhi: Aaur idsw kY ibKY su Gny imil nwcq hY kr gwn Bv`Xw ] kaun kmI kho hY iqn ko joaU sRI jdubIr ky Dwm Av`Xw ]2114]
transliteration: Aur Disaa Kai Bikhaai Su Ghane Mil(i) Naachat Hai Kar Gadn Bhavayyaa|| Kaoun Kamikaho Hai Tin Ko Jooo Srijadoubeer Ke Dhaam Avayyaa||2114||
translation: All are dancing together by revolving in all the directions, whosoever has come to the abode of Krishna, then tell us, what shortage he can have?2114.

gurmukhi: iqn ko bhu dY sMig pwrQ lY hir Bojn kI BUA mY pg DwrXo ] posq BwNg APIm mMgwie pIXo md Sok ibdw kir fwrXo ]
transliteration: Tin Ko Bahu Dai San(i) Paarath Lai Har(i) Bhojan Kibhooa Mai Pag Dhdaryo|| Post Bhaan Apheem Manade Peeyo Mad Shok Bidaa Kar(i) Ddaryo||
translation: Giving them many presents, Krihsna went to dine alongwith Arjuna; they made use of poppy seeds, hemp and opium and drank wine; thereby they removed all their sorrows;

gurmukhi: m`iq ho cwro eI kYPn so suq ieMdR kY so iem sXwm aucwrXo ] kwm kIXo bHmw Git ikau mdrw ko n AwTvo isMD svwrXo ]2115]
transliteration: Matt(i) Ho Chdaro Ikaiphan So Sout Indra Kai So Im Syaam Ouchdaryo|| Kaam Keeyo Brahmaa Ghattee Madraa Ko Na Aathvo Sindh Svdaryo||2115||
translation: Getting intoxicated with all these four stimulants Krishna said to Arjuna, “Brahma has done the right thing in not creating the eight ocean of wine.2115.

gurmukhi: qb pwrQ kir joir kY hir isau khXo sunwie ] jV bwmn ien rsn ko jwnY khw aupwie ]2116]
transliteration: Tab Paarath Kar(i) Jor(i) Kai Har(i) Sio Kahyo Sounaae|| Jad Baamanndin Rasan Ko Jaanai Kahaa Oupaae||2116||
translation: Then Arjuna said to Krishna with folded hands, “What do the senseless Brahmins know about the enjoyment of these essences and pleasures.”2116.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMDy purwx bicqR nwtky kiRSnvqwry ] biRKBnwQ AvD rwjy kI duihqw ibvwhq Bey ]
transliteration: It(i) Srisasam Sikandhe Puraan Bachitra Naatke Krishnaavatdare Brikhabhnaath Avadh Raaje Kiduhitaa Bivaahat Bhae||
translation: End of the story about he marriage with the daughter of the king Brikhbh Nath of Oudh after stringing the bulls in Krishnavatara (based on Dasham Skandh Purana) in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ ieMdR BUmwsur ky duK qy Awvq Bey kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Indra Bhoomasur Ke Doukh Te Aavat Bhae Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the Arrival of Indra on being agonised byh the demon Bhumasura
